summary: This bill, the Stabilize Medicaid and CHIP Coverage Act, aims to ensure continuous enrollment for individuals under the Medicaid program and the Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP). It amends sections of the Social Security Act to provide 12-month continuous enrollment. The bill removes age restrictions and modifies language related to eligibility for both Medicaid and CHIP. The effective date for the changes is set for the first day of the first fiscal quarter that begins on or after December 31, 2026.
